journalTitle: National Review of Sciences for Students
journalSubtitle: A journal by and for students
aboutDesc1: The National Review of Sciences for Students is a peer-reviewed, interdisciplinary publication written, edited, and curated by students and teachers from both high schools and universities. It is open to everyone, though it particularly encourages participation from Chileans. Its goal is to foster critical thinking and scientific research among young people through a serious, accessible, and rigorous publication system.
aboutDesc2: It is not associated with any specific institution, program, or school. It is an independent initiative open to all students. There is no cost; it is completely free and operates thanks to the commitment of our collaborators.
joinDesc: Be part of the National Review of Sciences for Students. Contribute your talent to scientific outreach and support students on their path to research. Select a role to learn about its responsibilities or apply for available positions.

founder.name: Founder
founder.description: The person who started the project, defining its vision and initial goals. Oversees the strategic direction of the journal.

cofounder.name: Co-Founder
cofounder.description: A key collaborator in founding the project, supporting the Founder in strategic decision-making.

director.name: General Director
director.description: Responsible for the overall vision, team coordination, external relations, and general oversight of the journal.

deputyDirector.name: Deputy General Director
deputyDirector.description: Assists the General Director in strategic decisions and takes over leadership in their absence.

chiefEditor.name: Chief Editor
chiefEditor.description: Oversees all content and coordinates the editorial team. Ensures article quality. Receives, organizes, and channels article submissions to reviewers.

sectionEditor.name: Section Editor
sectionEditor.description: Reviews and edits texts for a specific section (e.g., Opinion, Culture, News). Votes on whether to publish a work. Mainly applies corrections made by reviewers. Responsible for communicating with authors to request data and provide feedback.

reviewer.name: Reviewer / Editorial Committee
reviewer.description: Corrects style, spelling, and coherence of articles. Reviewers may also check sources, verify their quality, and assess content. Provides feedback to authors and votes on whether to publish an article.

webDeveloper.name: Web Developer
webDeveloper.description: Manages the website, fixes technical issues, and implements design and functionality improvements.

techSupport.name: Technical Support
techSupport.description: Resolves technical issues related to content uploads, forms, and emails.

socialMedia.name: Social Media Manager
socialMedia.description: Manages social media platforms (Instagram, X, TikTok, etc.), publishes content, and promotes the journal.

graphicDesigner.name: Graphic Designer
graphicDesigner.description: Creates visual materials such as posters, covers, and templates for social media.

communityManager.name: Community Manager
communityManager.description: Interacts with the community, responds to messages, and encourages participation on the journal's platforms.

newCollaborators.name: New Collaborators Manager
newCollaborators.description: Guides new applicants for administrative, reviewer, or editor roles.

eventCoordinator.name: Event or Call Coordinator
eventCoordinator.description: Organizes talks, debates, contests, or other activities to promote the journal.

legalAdvisor.name: Legal/Editorial Advisor
legalAdvisor.description: Reviews legal terms, editorial guidelines, and copyright issues for the journal (NOT NEEDED AT THE MOMENT).

financeManager.name: Finance/Transparency Manager
financeManager.description: Manages donations or budgets, ensuring financial transparency (NOT NEEDED AT THE MOMENT).

tutorial.revisor1: As Reviewer 1, your role is to review technical aspects such as grammar, spelling, source citation, AI-generated content detection, logical coherence, and general article structure. Leave detailed comments in the Google Drive document to suggest improvements. Ensure the language is clear and academic. You must leave your feedback to the author in the corresponding box. Additionally, you must leave a summary report explaining your observations to guide the editor. Finally, in the vote box you must put 'yes' if you approve the article, and 'no' if you reject it.
tutorial.revisor2: As Reviewer 2, focus on substantive content: verify the accuracy of sources, the seriousness and originality of the topic, the relevance of arguments, and the contribution to the field of study. Evaluate whether the article is innovative and well-founded. Leave comments in the Google Drive document. You must leave your feedback to the author in the corresponding box. Additionally, you must leave a summary report explaining your observations to guide the editor. Finally, in the vote box you must put 'yes' if you approve the article, and 'no' if you reject it.
tutorial.editor: As Editor, your responsibility is to review the reviewers' feedback and reports, integrate them with your own evaluation, and write sensitive and constructive final feedback for the author. Correct the text directly if necessary and decide the final status of the article. Use the Google Drive document for edits. You must leave feedback to the author synthesizing what the reviewers left. Your duty is to make the message accurate and sensitive, without demotivating the author. For this you must use the 'sandwich' technique. If you don't know what it is, enter here. Then leave your report with the changes made, they must be precise and academic. Finally, in the vote box you must put 'yes' if you approve the article, and 'no' if you reject it.

grammar.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Many serious errors, difficult to read.
grammar.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Very few errors, clean text.

structure.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Introduction, development and conclusion well differentiated.

citation.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: No sources or poorly cited.
citation.1: 1 = Adequate ⚖️: Sources present but with errors.
citation.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Reliable sources and well cited.

relevance.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Irrelevant topic or out of context.

rigor.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Varied, reliable and well-used sources.

originality.1: 1 = Adequate ⚖️: Combines ideas without much elaboration.
originality.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Contributes original ideas and reflections.

arguments.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Confusing, without evidence or incoherent.

modifications.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Required too many corrections, almost rewrite.
modifications.1: 1 = Adequate ⚖️: Needed several corrections, but manageable.

final_quality.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Even with changes, still weak or unclear.
final_quality.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Solid, clear and publishable text.

contribution.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Very valuable, innovative or inspiring.

motivational_potential.0: 0 = Insufficient ❌: Does not motivate nor contribute to the journal's spirit.
motivational_potential.2: 2 = Excellent ✅: Inspires, invites reflection and dialogue.
